alert.note: Alert for Itawamba; Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:24PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Itawamba and Monroe Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1024 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Weston, or near Hamilton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amory, Aberdeen, Smithville, Tremont, Hatley, Gattman, Binford, Sipsey Fork, New Hamilton, Becker, Quincy, Turon, Splunge, Wise Gap, Athens, Strong, East Aberdeen, Muldon, Greenwood Springs and Parham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
